intro: Adenanthos crenatus, commonly known as the serrated adenanthos, is a flowering plant native to south-western Australia. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are narrow and serrated, giving it a distinctive appearance. Adenanthos crenatus is well adapted to the dry, Mediterranean climate of its native region.
